info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:03PM CDT until August 29 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT FOR PUTNAM AND SOUTHEASTERN BUREAU COUNTIES... At 1203 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Granville, or near Hennepin, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Putnam and southeastern Bureau Counties, including the following locations... Putnam, Providence, Mark, Standard, Milo, Lake Thunderbird, Magnolia, Florid and Lone Tree Corners. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
